intro: Lipozygis villosa, commonly known as the hairy lipozygis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its clusters of small, fragrant flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
